intro: Ipomoea obscura, commonly known as the dark morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a climbing vine that produces heart-shaped leaves and small, pale violet to white flowers. The plant belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes other familiar species like morning glories. Its flowers typically open in the early morning and close by midday, a characteristic known as nyctinasty. Ipomoea obscura is often found in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and along stream banks.
